And whether the Ministers of Christ have not their power from Christ, who saith, I will be with you to the end of the world? And whether it is not Q. Maries Law that causeth the Saints now to suffer, as it did in the dayes of Q. Mary? And whether Q. Maries Law is not the Priests defence to guard them, as it was Q. Maries Priests, and did them? And whether any of the Priests that are guarded with that law can take the Oath of Abjuration, which is against Popery and the Supremacy of the Pope of Rome, but they must be sound false swearers against that which guards them? And let us see how the Priests of the world can get this Cloake off their backes?

And whether that the reasonablenesse did not in all ages stand out of that, that did persecute, which had its instruction from God, both Law and Gospel, not of man nor by man? And whether there was not a Ministry in all ages out of the life which got the forme in the unreasonablenes, which was stood against with the Spirit of God in them in whom it was, from which Spirit the words were declared, and they which were in the unreasonablenes got the forme but with the Spirit were judged.

Was not Q. Maries Law made to limit the Spirit of God, though she called a Defender of the Faith, and was not her Law to guard that which was against the Spirit of God, and to hold it up which the Spirit of God witnessed against? And is not the Spirit of God now to witnesse against that roote and branch, which was made against it to limit it? and all that which doth authorize that which limitts the Spirit of God and is against it? Against all that the Spirit of God stands a witnesse, its beginning, its ending, and its foundation, which is to be raced out? They who are here have the power
from God, who are in the Spirit of God, which to the Spirits in prison ministers and are manifest and written in one anothers hearts by the Spirit of the living God, which Spirit is the Judge of all Popery and Popish wayes, lapps them up together and fathomes and comprehends and judgeth them and condemnes them and tramples upon them. So take away the Popish Law take away the Priests life. Now all may see what is in the Priests heart, for there is his guard by which the Saints are cast into prison, which cast them into prison in the dayes of Q. Mary; For see how many Priests will preach without the Popish Law, and have a Spirit to defend their Ministry: Trie them here with the Oath of Abinration who cry against Popery, yet dare not venture their Ministry without Q Maries Law which guarded the Popery, and cry against Jesuites, yet dare not venture their Ministry but as they are guarded by that Law that guarded the Jesuites?

And what doe you Priests thinke of those Protestants that suffered by Q. Maries Law, which now is your Guard by which many of the Saints were and are by you cast into prison, and can you cry against Popery, and yet cry to her Law to protect you without hypocrisie? And if you say you renounce Popery, then rencunce Q. Maries Law. When shall we see a Priest deny Q. Maries Law, the authority of Q Maries Church, and then among the Papists to Minister, to draw them from under Popery up to Christ, whose blood cleanseth from all sinne, and so shall not looke for a Purgatorie, he that doth this must be one that riseth from the dead, who hath his power from God, and comes to life, who breakes downe all the dead Images and Crosses and likenesses; who is here, witnesseth Christ with him to the end of the world, marke, to the worlds end, that is farre beyond Q. Maries Act or Authority or Supremacie, or all the Popes power and authority, but who is in this power of the Lord Jesus defaceth it all and sees before the world was and it was, and he is with them who is the wisdome of God and the power of God, by which they answer that of God in every man, the light which brings them out of all visible things to Christ from whence the light comes, him by whom the world was made before it was made, for to be carnally minded is death, & that goes from the light which comes from Christ, and so the mind being in the death it imitates Crosses and setts up an image and likenes, and bowes downe to that, a likenes set up he who is from the light, but he who is guided by the light with the light which comes from Christ up to Christ, here is the crosse to keepe the mind out of all things that are carnall or bending to them, with the light up to Christ, who is eternal which changeth not, and here the mind is spirituall, where there is peace out of all the worlds power and authority in the power and authority of Christ. That which is out of the light is out of the power and out of the truth, out of the light in the carnall, in the enmity where the murtherer is, out of the light where the likenes of truth which is not truth, that which is out of the light: So that which is out of the light is out of the truth, having a likenesse of truth not the truth, but is the death and enmity, that power is of selfe and of the Devill, and is with the light condemned, which from Christ doth come, to whom all power in heaven and earth is given, which power judgeth the other, which is out of the light out of the truth and abides not in it.
